page.title: 08MEMORIES (continued)
page.content: There seemed to be more children in the village when I was young because the cottages were built for fishermen and quarrymen. Now they seem to be lived in by families whose children have grown up. I have recently been injured in a quarry accident and enjoy sitting during my convalescence looking at the view of the sea and the countryside. I enjoy watching the sporting activities the sea brings. We have a lovely view from our home half way up the hill. It is quiet here. Life has meant hard work but I have been very happy and would never like to move. It is my home.
